other_tests.findings: There is minimal dependent atelectasis in the left lower lobe. A hypodense lesion measures 0.9 x 0.7 cm in segment 7, which may represent a biliary hamartoma, cyst, or hemangioma. The appendix is retrocecal, fluid-filled, and dilated, measuring a maximum diameter of 1.2 cm with adjacent fatty stranding. No evidence of intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary dilatation.
MIXED BACTERIAL FLORA (>= 3 COLONY TYPES), CONSISTENT WITH SKIN AND/OR GENITAL CONTAMINATION.
Regular rate and rhythm, no murmurs.
